knowledge.question: What has CAM (Content Addressable Memory) tables that map a physical ports to MAC addresses
explanation: Incorrect: A hub is a common connection point for devices in a network. Hubs are devices commonly used to connect segments of a LAN.
Incorrect: Repeaters are used in transmission systems to regenerate analog or digital signals distorted by transmission loss.
Correct: A switch uses Content Addressable Memory (CAM) tables which stores information such as MAC addresses available on physical ports with their MAC addresses.
Incorrect: A DHCP server automatically assigns an IP address and other information to each host on the network so they can communicate efficiently with other endpoints.
